snippet: Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina suggested that the shootings may have been the work of homegrown militants aligned with her political opponents in the Bangladesh Nationalist Party.
abstract: Bangladeshi Prime Min Sheikh Hasina rejects speculation that fatal shootings of Japanese man and Italian aid worker were carried out by agents of Islamic State and suggests killings were work of militants aligned with her political opponents.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina suggested that the shootings may have been the work of homegrown militants aligned with her political opponents in the Bangladesh Nationalist Party.

headline.main: Bangladesh Skeptical of Claims That ISIS Was Behind Shootings of Foreigners
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Skeptical of Claims ISIS Was Behind Shootings

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
